text: - hood housing on digest hello my needle
drops Anthony Fantana here Internet's
busiest music nerd I know today I
usually do a question of the week but I
didn't think anyone would complain if I
did a review of the new deer hunter
instead before I start there's an album
over at the needle drop calm link down
there in the D box and you can download
it for free the name of the group is
soft powers and the name of the LP is
bad pop it's very low fie fuzzy catchy
stuff maybe if you're a fan of Ariel
pink are Stevie Moore that kind of thing
you'll dig on it just has a nice fun
self recorded sound alright this is deer
hunters fourth studio LP Halcyon digest
and if you're not familiar with deer
hunter their band a Georgia band who's a
part of this new wave or newfound
appreciation of my generation for
psychedelic music their discography dear
hunter has proven themselves to be
experimenters but they've always managed
to keep pretty much most of their albums
very welcoming very immediate there's a
lot of adventure that goes on in their
music with strange effects weird sounds
but they beef that stuff up with just
some great songwriting so you could
really enjoy this band for one reason or
the other if you enjoyed deer hunters
past LP micro castle this will not be
too hard of a transition for you
especially if you're into frontman
Bradford Cox solo work under the name
Atlas sound because this LP to me is
actually sounding maybe more like a
fleshed out full band version of Atlas
sounds last album logos and to go back
to Micro Castle though that album didn't
have its quiet moments its ambient
moments that thing feels like so much
more of a rock album for me is it
especially considering the tracks like
nothing ever happened or on that thing
this LP never really gets as distorted
or as abrasive as that album it really
lacks the tension for me of micro Castle
and even cryptograms what little aggress
you may have found on deer hunters past
work is really not here on this LP
however that's not a bad thing the band
has replaced that feeling with something
that is much more easygoing the tracks
here range from being gentle to being
playful to being blissful plus there are
some things on here to suggest at least
a little bit of a stylistic shift for
deer hunter like the piano and sax combo
on the track Coronado or the opening
groove on the track revival or the hook
on desire lines or the Everly Brothers
like vocal on basement scene a lot of
these tracks scream pop record but I
wouldn't say Deer Hunter has lost their
taste for experimentation the noise the
phantom sounds all that stuff is still
here it's just more condensed and weaved
into the songwriting so much more a lot
of the instruments in deer hunters
previous LPS bleed into each other
sonically kind of making some of them
hard to pull apart that is even more of
I don't want to say an issue but just
the case on Halcyon digest which is
completely intentional and maybe makes
this LP feel a little dirtier than Micro
Castle in some respects even in it
sketchiest moments a couple songs like
the opener like the fourth track sailing
are very repetitive maybe a little
minimal maybe a little skeletal and are
somewhat dreamy just wandering linear
sort of and this is really the only
point in time where Deerhunter
is kind of just letting everything cast
out not really adhering to a structure
and though these songs may not be the
most thrilling pieces of the album it's
still a nice counterpoint from those
more straightforward moments and of
course one other song that fits this
bill is the closer he would have laughed
which everybody is talking about
everybody's building up a lot of buzz
behind this song because Bradford Cox
has said that it's actually about Jay
now you guys know I love Jay the
first out my reviewed on this channel
was a Jay album I own the guy's solo
stuff and I interviewed them once too
for the website however that doesn't
necessarily mean I'm in love with the
last song of this LP it's okay it starts
with a good groove I like Bradford Cox
vocal delivery in there but it just
doesn't engage me for the entire 7 plus
minutes that it lasts so to kind of sum
up here you've got some very lush
production on this release some great
personality for Bradford Cox coming
through on the lyrics very memorable
melodies very memorable hooks Plus this
is the most I've ever heard the songs
take precedent over the experimentation
and the sonic aspects of the album from
Deerhunter my only real gripes that
there were probably three tracks that I
didn't hate but just kind of paled in
comparison to others I'm feeling an
extremely extremely strong 8 on this
thing almost a light 9 but I just enjoy
the hell out of a lot of these tracks
yeah a lot of course I'm highly
recommending this I'm putting it on the
loved list and yeah that's it of course
many of you guys have already heard it
and if you have let me know down there
in the comments what you thought of it
what was your favorite track what was
your favorite moment and what did you
think of this LP in context of deer
hunters previous album Anthony Fantan oh
dear hunter Halcyon Digest forever
